title: Giant greenhouse planned for Greater Cincinnati
text: Enlarge BrightFarms, a Manhattan-based startup, builds greenhouses outside urban areas including… more A new farm that is expected to be the most sustainable in Ohio will include a huge greenhouse that will be built in Wilmington in Clinton County, about 55 miles northeast of Cincinnati. BrightFarms Inc. is planning to build a 160,000-square-foot facility that will use scalable, sustainable and local farming methods that employ less energy, land and water than conventional agriculture. Enlarge BrightFarms, a Manhattan-based startup, builds greenhouses outside urban areas including… more The farm is expected to create more than 30 permanent jobs, reduce the amount of miles food has to travel to consumers and improve the environmental impact of the food supply chain. An exact location and cost for the project haven't been announced. New York-based BrightFarms has been named one of the 50 most innovative companies by Fast Company Magazine along with one of the top 10 most innovative companies in food. Since 2011, the company has partnered with multiple major supermarket chains and it has several commercial-scale greenhouses currently in development.
